title: How many books are sold each year? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is too broad a question. If you’d like to find out a ballpark number, you might split it up in a few general categories, like fictionnon-fictionAnd then split it even further, depending on subgenres. And then add up the numbers. Nowadays most are sold online. And retailers like to keep their data as private as possible — wouldn’t you? You have Amazon — the biggest book seller in the world; with all its regionals + book depositoryiBooksGoogle booksBarnes & Nobleall the other online and offline bookshopsThe data concerning the actual, real, unaltered booksales of a platform will never be publicly available. However, there are some stats that someone might offer. For example, for my niche, I’m interested in serial readers, because they are the ones that make up the most of my revenue. Last time I checked — and it took me just a little over two months to gather the necessary data — there were a few million serial readers worldwide. I won’t give any further info on that, given the amount of time and sleepless nights — plus I’d be creating competition for myself — but you can start with social media and make your way into narrower regions of the web. Nobody knows exactly how many books are sold globally, each year, and whoever pertains to know the answer has something up their sleeve — an agenda or wanting some attention. Hope that helps. Richard
